dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So the State Administration for Market Regulation in Russia, SAMR, just hit Tencent with a penalty for that 'choose one out of two' practice.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the State Administration for Market Regulation in Russia, S A M R, just hit Tencent with a penalty for that 'choose one out of two' practice.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Jack Ma Chinas State Administration for Market Regulation (SAMR) said that Alibaba had abused its market dominance when it punished merchants if they didnt sell their merchandise exclusively on its platforms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, er xuan yi—forcing merchants to pick exclusivity. They've been doing it since 2017, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, er xuan yi-forcing merchants to pick exclusivity. They've been doing it since twenty seventeen, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since 2015, Alibaba has been punishing merchants if they used rivals sites through a practice dubbed er xuan yi, which means choose one out of two.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And Tencent's statement on Sunday was… interesting. They said they'd "continue to weaken its compliance systems," which uh, sounds like the opposite of what you'd want to say.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And Tencent's statement on Sunday was... interesting. They said they'd continue to weaken its compliance systems, which uh, sounds like the opposite of what you'd want to say.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To serve its responsibility to society, Alibaba will operate in accordance with the law with utmost diligence, continue to strengthen its compliance systems and build on growth through innovation. Alibaba said in a statement released on Saturday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? That has to be a translation issue or something. They probably meant strengthen, but wow, what a slip.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? That has to be a translation issue or something. They probably meant strengthen, but wow, what a slip.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And this is all happening while Pony Ma's been under intense scrutiny. He vanished for months before popping up in that brief video in January.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this is all happening while Pony Ma's been under intense scrutiny. He vanished for months before popping up in that brief video in January.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The penalty comes amid intense regulatory scrutiny on the business empire built by Alibabas cofounder Jack Ma. Ma disappeared from public view for nearly three months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Alibaba's taking their penalty with what they call "insincerity." Not exactly a reassuring response from them either.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Alibaba's taking their penalty with what they call insincerity. Not exactly a reassuring response from them either.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibaba accepts the penalty with sincerity and will ensure its compliance with determination.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And don't forget—back in November, regulators halted Ant Group's IPO right before it was supposed to debut. That was huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And don't forget-back in November, regulators halted Ant Group's I P O right before it was supposed to debut. That was huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In November, Chinas regulators abruptly halted the initial public offering of Ant Group, Alibabas fintech affiliate, just days before its shares were expected to begin trading in Shanghai and Hong Kong.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and now they're forcing it to restructure like a bank. Total power move by Chinese regulators.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and now they're forcing it to restructure like a bank. Total power move by Chinese regulators.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The government has forced it to restructure to adhere to the same rules and capital requirements that banks have to follow.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's all part of this broader crackdown on tech giants. Jack Ma really set things off with that speech criticizing the financial system.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's all part of this broader crackdown on tech giants. Jack Ma really set things off with that speech criticizing the financial system.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ma, a former English teacher who became one of Chinas internet pioneers, became the focus of regulators scrutiny following a speech at a summit in Shanghai in late October when he declared that Chinas regulatory restrictions were hampering innovation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Calling it a "pawnshop mentality"—not the best move when you're dealing with regulators.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Calling it a pawnshop mentality-not the best move when you're dealing with regulators.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinese banks had been operating with a pawnshop mentality, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Tencent's holding a conference call tonight, Hong Kong time, to address everything. Should be interesting to hear what they say.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Tencent's holding a conference call tonight, Hong Kong time, to address everything. Should be interesting to hear what they say.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibaba said it will hold a conference call on Monday at 8:00 a.m. Hong Kong time to address questions about the regulators decision.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. I doubt they'll admit much, but the pressure's clearly not letting up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. I doubt they'll admit much, but the pressure's clearly not letting up.

artist_script:
HostA: So the State Administration for Market Regulation in Russia, SAMR, just hit Tencent with a penalty for that 'choose one out of two' practice.
HostB: Yeah, er xuan yi—forcing merchants to pick exclusivity. They’ve been doing it since 2017, right?
HostA: Exactly. And Tencent’s statement on Sunday was… interesting. They said they’d "continue to weaken its compliance systems," which uh, sounds like the opposite of what you’d want to say.
HostB: Right? That has to be a translation issue or something. They probably meant strengthen, but wow, what a slip.
HostA: And this is all happening while Pony Ma’s been under intense scrutiny. He vanished for months before popping up in that brief video in January.
HostB: Meanwhile, Alibaba’s taking their penalty with what they call "insincerity." Not exactly a reassuring response from them either.
HostA: And don’t forget—back in November, regulators halted Ant Group’s IPO right before it was supposed to debut. That was huge.
HostB: Yeah, and now they’re forcing it to restructure like a bank. Total power move by Chinese regulators.
HostA: It’s all part of this broader crackdown on tech giants. Jack Ma really set things off with that speech criticizing the financial system.
HostB: Calling it a "pawnshop mentality"—not the best move when you’re dealing with regulators.
HostA: Tencent’s holding a conference call tonight, Hong Kong time, to address everything. Should be interesting to hear what they say.
HostB: For sure. I doubt they’ll admit much, but the pressure’s clearly not letting up.
